definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: My parents turn in public grain to the state every year .
sentences.chinese: 我父母每年向国家交公粮。

sentences.english: At present hundreds of people are fed with public grain in each commune, so this is a formidable problem.
sentences.chinese: 现在一个公社有几百人吃公粮，这个问题很大。

definition: grain bought by the state and resold to areas undergoing a grain shortage
lit. imperial funding for troops/funds or items supplied by the government
work point (measure of work completed in a rural commune in the PRC during the planned economy era)
taxation/in former times, esp. land tax
to apportion expenses, responsibilities etc/to demand contributions
fixed government purchase (esp of farm products)
